author: KENS 5 Eyewitness News
title: FEMA opens resource center in Kerrville for survivors, homeowners affected by deadly Texas floods - NewsBreak
text:
Kerrville
FEMA opens resource center in Kerrville for survivors, homeowners affected by deadly Texas floods
1 hours ago
The center is where survivors can talk to someone face-to-face, get help with applications and learn more about support available.
1

author: visao.sapo.pt
title: Braga: Aquisição de 234 veículos elétricos e híbridos reduz emissões de CO2 | e24.pt
text:
e24 > Notícias > Cávado > Braga > Braga: Aquisição de 234 veículos elétricos e híbridos reduz emissões de CO2 Braga Cávado Braga: Aquisição de 234 veículos elétricos e híbridos reduz emissões de CO2 Nuno Cerqueira Publicado a 5 de Julho de 2024 Adicionar um comentário Partilhar 1 minuto(s) de leitura Foto: DR Partilhar – Publicidade – O Pacto de Mobilidade Empresarial de Braga (PMEB) anunciou um progresso significativo na redução das emissões de gases com efeito estufa, com 82% dos compromissos iniciais cumpridos. Foto: DR A aquisição de 116 veículos elétricos e 118 híbridos plug-in pela Câmara resultou numa redução imediata de 405 toneladas de CO2.
Destaques da Notícia O Pacto de Mobilidade Empresarial de Braga (PMEB) anunciou um progresso significativo na redução das emissões de gases com efeito estufa, com 82% dos compromissos iniciais cumpridos. A iniciativa, promovida pela autarquia e o BCSD Portugal, visa expandir o número de empresas signatárias e as ações de sustentabilidade. Anualmente, Braga espera evitar a emissão adicional de 281 toneladas de CO2, com base nos quilómetros percorridos em 2023.
Foram ainda instaladas 168 tomadas elétricas e criados 132 lugares de estacionamento para veículos elétricos.
- Publicidade - O presidente da Câmara de Braga, Ricardo Rio , elogiou o empenho das empresas na mobilidade sustentável, destacando “a importância da colaboração contínua para um futuro com menos emissões”.
A iniciativa, promovida pela autarquia e o BCSD Portugal, visa expandir o número de empresas signatárias e as ações de sustentabilidade.

author: Yahoo News
title: Watch: Famous GOP Presidential Candidate Dragged to Hell For Omitting Slavery from the Civil War
text:
The Root Watch: Famous GOP Presidential Candidate Dragged to Hell For Omitting Slavery from the Civil War Candace McDuffie December 28, 2023 at 11:20 PM · 2 min read 42 Link Copied Read full article Photo: Scott Olson (Getty Images) Oops! Something went wrong. Please try again later. More content below
The bar for GOP presidential candidate Nikki Haley has always been in hell, but she somehow continuously lowers it. This time, she omitted slavery as a reason for the Civil War during a campaign stop in Berlin, New Hampshire, on Wednesday. Now, she’s attempting to do damage control.
It went down like this: “What was the cause of the United States Civil War?” a man asked the former U.N. ambassador and South Carolina governor during yesterday’s event. Her reply? “Well, don’t come with an easy question. I think the cause of the Civil War was basically how government was going to run, the freedoms and what people could and couldn’t do,” Haley responded.
Read more
Rebel Moon's Ed Skrein on Co-Starring With His Game of Thrones Replacement
Staffer Suggests George Santos May Have Broken His Own Car Window So He'd Have A Reason To Yell At Mayor Adams
The Best RPGs Of 2023
Max Verstappen Too Young To Rent AMG GT Sports Car On Vacation, Settles For BMW 5 Series
Watch A SWAT Battering Ram End A Highway Truck Chase In Texas
Democratic National Committee chair Jaime Harrison called Haley’s response “a slap in the face to Black voters.” He stated:
“This isn’t hard: condemning slavery is the baseline for anyone who wants to be President of the United States, but Nikki Haley and the rest of the MAGA GOP are choking on their words trying to rewrite history.”
President Biden simply replied to the video on X/Twitter by commenting: “It was about slavery.” Then on a local radio show, “The Pulse of NH,” Haley attempted to save her campaign with, “Of course the Civil War was about slavery. We know that. That’s the easy part of it.”
She didn’t stop there.
“I want to nip it in the bud. Yes, we know the Civil War was about slavery. But more than that, what’s the lesson in all this? That freedom matters,” she said. “And individual rights and liberties matter for all people. That’s the blessing of America. That was a stain on America when we had slavery.”
She added, “But what we want is [to] never relive it, never let anyone take those freedoms away again.”
Haley may have risen in the polls, but she has definitely lowered herself among many of our Black thought-leaders like Nicole Hannah-Jones. About Haley’s slavery snub, she posted on X , “It’s not even a hard question. It’s absurd that she felt she had to evade the question to avoid political liability.”
That.
More from The Root
The State Of The Nintendo Switch In 2023
Elon Musk Is Mad About Reporting On His Robots Injuring Workers, And He Has A Point
Atlanta Area Family Finds Out The Hard Way That New Cars Can Melt In The Sun
American Cars Are Huge And Unsafe, But Automakers Don't Want The Simple Solution
Gypsy Rose Blanchard has been released from prison and hopes to meet Taylor Swift

author: newsytoday
title: "Monkeypox Virus Spread: What It Means for the Netherlands, Explained by a Tilburg Medical Microbiologist"
text:
Breaking News: Monkeypox Virus Threatens Netherlands ; Expert Warns of Potential Spread
B automóvel, NL — The Netherlands braces for a potential monkeypox outbreak as the virus , previously contained in Africa, gains traction worldwide. Tilburg-based microbiologist Dr. Hans Zalm provides insights into what this threat means for the Netherlands.
Monkeypox, a rare viral infection with symptoms similar to smallpox, has recently surfaced in Europe and North America, fueling concerns about a global spread. With the first case of the mpox variant reported in France this week, experts warn that the Netherlands could be next.
"Given the current global situation, it’s only a matter of time before we see a case in the Netherlands," says Dr. Zalm, a renowned microbiologist at Tilburg University. "The virus is spreading, and it’s no longer confined to remote areas in Africa."
The monkeypox virus is contagious, spreading through close contact with infected individuals or their contaminated materials. Symptoms include fever, swollen lymph nodes, and a distinctive rash that develops into fluid-filled lesions.
Although mortality rates are low—around 1% in the current outbreak—Dr. Zalm cautions that the virus poses a significant threat, particularly to immunocompromised individuals and healthcare workers.
"We must not underestimate this virus," he warns. "It has the potential to cause an outbreak, and we should prepare accordingly."
Dr. Ab Osterhaus, another prominent Dutch virologist, echoes these concerns. In an interview with Telegraaf.nl , he warns that mpox could reach the Netherlands and encourages vigilance: "There’s a chance that this virus could also spread to the Netherlands."
As European countries like Spain, Portugal, and Belgium report monkeypox cases, experts advise the Netherlands to step up surveillance and preparedness efforts. Dr. Zalm urges the public to stay informed and follow hygiene guidelines to minimize the risk of transmission.
"Personal hygiene measures, like regular handwashing and avoiding close contact with infected individuals, can help prevent the spread of this virus," he says.
While fears of a monkeypox pandemic are unfounded, given its lower transmissibility compared to SARS-COV-2, the Netherlands remains vigilant against this emerging threat. Ducks and swans in the country’s waterways may soon receive a new visitor, and understanding the potential impact is crucial for preparing an effective response.
